info.bio: Nick Snyder is a front-end developer with a passion for crafting visually stunning and user-friendly websites. With fifteen years of experience using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, Nick leverages his skills to create immersive digital experiences that captivate and engage users. Nick has worked with many Fortune 500 brands, including: Abbvie, Aetna, Amazon, Bank of America, ESPN, Humana, Intuit, Microsoft, and the National Football League. In his free time, Nick enjoys playing baseball, hiking, and laying in hammocks.

live.title: The Halo 5 Effect
live.notes: A long-form "featured article" used to celebrate the launch of Halo 5. Includes stylized photo borders, custom typographic elements, and branded photo carousels.

live.title: Microsoft: Inside B87
live.notes: Notes: Created to showcase "the world's quietest room" where Microsoft conducts sound experiements. Website made with three.js and includes several interactive widgets that make the website feel similar to a museum kiosk. A screenshot of the website was featured in the "Weekend Update" segment of Saturday Night Live.

live.title: What If?: The motor that drives machine learning
live.notes: A hybrid "featured article" and microsite used to highlight Microsoft's advancements in machine learning and encourage recruitment. The collection of "sub-articles" was created using a Node.js-based static site generator/CMS that I created for the agency.

live.title: Female Forward Together
live.notes: Created in order to spread awareness and destigmatize menstrual cycles.

live.title: TimePayment.com
live.notes: Helped to maintain, update, and upgrade website after agency hand-off. Focus was primiarly enhancing user experience design (UX) for both customers and internal staff. Introduced a WordPress-based page builder to increase production speed of new pages.

live.title: Filium.com
live.notes: Created to showcase waterproof fabric technology. Features a responsive video header and parallax effects.

live.title: Hugh MacLeod Connects the Dots
live.notes: A long-form "featured article" showcasing artist Hugh MacLeod. Features an animated header and parallax scrolling effects.

archived.title: Operation: Silent Knight
archived.notes: A "video Christmas card" created in lieu of a printed one that is handed out to vendors each year. The video depicts Santa Claus participating in "flight training" using the suborbital flight simulator created for Virgin Galactic training. The video was picked up by GeekDad, a blog hosted by Wired.com.

archived.title: NFL Activate
archived.notes: Allowed commercial sponsors of NFL events to review impressions receieved after the air of events, including: NFL Draft, NFL Kickoff, and Super Bowl. To help manage the final numbers and quickly turn-around results, I created a simple content management system (CMS), which I dubbed Touchdown. For my work, I was given a letter of praise—sent to the agency—from NFL corporate.

archived.title: SAVES Club
archived.notes: Utilized several parallax techniques and a custom video-to-image video scrubber to showcase the internal features of Safariland's protective vest for law enforcement. Subtle animations are used in the background, as well, to give the site more visual interest.

archived.title: Amazon: reInvent
archived.notes: This project utilized a static site generator that I created using Node.js, allowing for a up-to-the-minute, consistent changes while maintaining the speed and simplicity of a static website.

archived.title: Microsoft Design
archived.notes: Created as a tool for Microsoft to showcase their current designers and recruit new designers.

archived.title: ESPN Event Wrap-Ups
archived.notes: Hosted public impressions and ratings of ESPN events (X Games, ESPYs, Bowl College Series, NEXT) to demonstrate value and ROI to advertisers.

archived.title: Welcome to Aetna
archived.notes: Created to help new members of Aetna navigate and understand services provided by Aetna.
